tool.name: msort
tool.description: - sort tabular data by multiple fields
tool.command:
msort.py
## Inputs --infile=$infile --sort_specified_fields=$sort_specified_fields
##Output --outfile=$outfile
## Check if using default or custom parameters --default_full_settings_type=$default_full_settings.settings_type #if $default_full_settings.settings_type == "full": --line_delimiters=$default_full_settings.line_delimiters --num_lines_per_block=$default_full_settings.num_lines_per_block --field_delimiters=$default_full_settings.field_delimiters ##--reverse_sort=$default_full_settings.reverse_sort ##--ignore_char_case=$default_full_settings.ignore_char_case ##--treat_fields_as_num=$default_full_settings.treat_fields_as_num ##--treat_fields_as_num_or_string=$default_full_settings.treat_fields_as_num_or_string #end if

param.name: settings_type
param.label: msort settings to use
param.help: Default settings is suitable for most needs. If you want full control, use Full parameter list

param.name: line_delimiters
param.label: Specify line delimiters used in input file

tool.help:
**What it does**
msort is a tool for re-arranging rows of tabular data by multiple fields.
**Configuration**
Options for sorting::
-r Reverse sort, it will be overwritten if fields are specified
-f Ignore character`s case
-n Treat fields as number
-m Treat fields as number or string
A notation is used for specifying fields to be sorted::
rn10[2-6] Reverse sort rows 2-6 (include 6) of column 10, treat it as a number
n11 Sort column 11, treat it as number
f2[6-] Sort 6-end of column 2, treat it as string, ignore case
rfm3 Reverse sort column 3, treat it as string or number, ignore string case
f3{red green blue}Sort column 3, treat it as a enum and ignore string case
**Attribution**
Msort was written by Ruan Jue at BGI-SZ.
**More information**
For test data and more detailed information, click here_.
.. _here: http://soap.genomics.org.cn/about.html#resource2
